snippet: Prosecutors in Pennsylvania said they hoped some of the $60 million in fines Penn State must pay the N.C.A.A. would be used to add to the state’s 21 children’s advocacy centers.
abstract: Prosecutors in Pennsylvania hope that some of the $60 million in fines Penn State must pay the NCAA will be used to add to the state’s 21 children’s advocacy centers.
lead_paragraph: Prosecutors in Pennsylvania said they hoped some of the $60 million in fines Penn State must pay the N.C.A.A. would be used to add to the state’s 21 children’s advocacy centers.

headline.main: Money From Penn State Sought for Children’s Advocacy Centers
headline.print_headline: Money From Penn State Sought For Children’s Advocacy Centers
